blocks.name: modprm1div
blocks.content: A prime number divides an integer minus 1 iff the integer modulo the prime number is 1. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-May-2023.)

blocks.name: m1dvdsndvds
blocks.content: If an integer minus 1 is divisible by a prime number, the integer itself is not divisible by this prime number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm m1dvdsndvds(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
} = {
  3imtr3d(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat1), wn(wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wi(wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat1), wn(wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0))))
  mtbii(wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat1), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0), wceq(nat1, nat0))
  neii(nat1, nat0)
  ax-1ne0()
  eqcoms(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat1, wb(wceq(nat1, nat0), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0)))
  eqeq1(nat1, co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0)
  modprm1div(c0, c1)
  notbid(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))
  bicomd(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c0), nat0)), wcel(c0, cn))
  prmnn(c0)
  dvdsval3(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm m1dvdsndvds(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(c0[||](c1[-]1)→ ¬ c0[||]c1))
} = {
  3imtr3d((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[||](c1[-]1), ¬ c0[||]c1, (c1[mod]c0)= 1, ¬(c1[mod]c0)= 0)
  a1i((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ((c1[mod]c0)= 1 → ¬(c1[mod]c0)= 0))
  mtbii((c1[mod]c0)= 1, (c1[mod]c0)= 0, 1 = 0)
  neii(nat1, nat0)
  ax-1ne0()
  eqcoms((c1[mod]c0), nat1, (1 = 0 ↔(c1[mod]c0)= 0))
  eqeq1(nat1, (c1[mod]c0), nat0)
  modprm1div(c0, c1)
  notbid((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c1[mod]c0)= 0, c0[||]c1)
  bicomd((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c1[mod]c0)= 0, c0[||]c1)
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0[||]c1 ↔(c1[mod]c0)= 0), c0 ∈ ℕ)
  prmnn(c0)
  dvdsval3(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: modprminv
blocks.content: Show an explicit expression for the modular inverse of ` A mod P ` . This is an application of ~ prmdiv . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-May-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm modprminv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wa(wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0))
} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wa(wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1)), wa(wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))))
  prmdiv(c0, c1, c2)
  pm5.32d(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wi(wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1)))))
  expr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cprime), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cz))
  sylan2(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzelz(c2, nat1, co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  zmulcl(c1, c2)
  modprm1div(c0, co(c1, cmul, c2))
}

blocks.name: modprminveq
blocks.content: The modular inverse of ` A mod P ` is unique. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm modprminveq(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wb(wa(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1)), wceq(c2, c3)))
  -| wceq(c3, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0))
} = {
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wa(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1)), wceq(c2, c3), wa(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))))
  pm5.32d(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wi(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1)))))
  expr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cprime), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cz))
  sylan2(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzelz(c2, nat0, co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  zmulcl(c1, c2)
  modprm1div(c0, co(c1, cmul, c2))
  prmdiveq(c0, c1, c2, c3)
}

blocks.name: vfermltl
blocks.content: Variant of Fermat's little theorem if ` A ` is not a multiple of ` P ` , see theorem 5.18 in [ApostolNT] p. 113. (Contributed by AV, 21-Aug-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm vfermltl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0), nat1))
} = {
  3eqtrd(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0), nat1, co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmo, c0), co(nat1, cmo, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  oveq1d(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0, co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  oveq2d(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cphi, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cphi, c0)))
  eqcomd(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cphi, c0), wcel(c0, cprime))
  phiprm(c0)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmo, c0), co(nat1, cmo, c0)), wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wcel(c0, cn))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)))
  eqtrd(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1, co(c0, cgcd, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), co(c0, cgcd, c1)), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  anim1ci(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  prmz(c0)
  gcdcom(c1, c0)
  biimp3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  coprm(c0, c1)
  eulerth(c0, c1)
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(nat1, cmo, c0), nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)))
  jca(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0))
  nnred(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  prmnn(c0)
  prmgt1(c0)
  1mod(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm vfermltl(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1)→((c1[^](c0[-]1))[mod]c0)= 1)
} = {
  3eqtrd(((c1[^](c0[-]1))[mod]c0), nat1, ((c1[^](φ ` c0))[mod]c0), (1[mod]c0), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1))
  oveq1d((c1[^](c0[-]1)), cmo, c0, (c1[^](φ ` c0)), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1))
  oveq2d(c1, cexp, (c0[-]1), (φ ` c0), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1))
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1, (c0[-]1)=(φ ` c0))
  eqcomd((c0[-]1), (φ ` c0), c0 ∈ Prime)
  phiprm(c0)
  syl3anc((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1), ((c1[^](φ ` c0))[mod]c0)=(1[mod]c0), c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1[gcd]c0)= 1)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1, c0 ∈ ℕ)
  simp2(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1)
  eqtrd((c1[gcd]c0), nat1, (c0[gcd]c1), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1))
  syl((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1), (c1[gcd]c0)=(c0[gcd]c1), (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  3adant3(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1, (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  anim1ci(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(c0)
  gcdcom(c1, c0)
  biimp3a(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1)
  coprm(c0, c1)
  eulerth(c0, c1)
  syl((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ ¬ c0[||]c1), (1[mod]c0)= 1, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[<]c0))
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c0[||]c1, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[<]c0))
  jca(c0 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℝ, 1[<]c0)
  nnred(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  prmnn(c0)
  prmgt1(c0)
  1mod(c0)
}

blocks.name: vfermltlALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ vfermltl , not using Euler's theorem. (Contributed by AV, 21-Aug-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm vfermltlALT(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0), nat1))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0), nat1, co(co(c1, cmul, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0)), cmo, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  3eqtr2d(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0), co(co(c1, cmul, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0)), cmo, c0), co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmul, c1), cmo, c0), co(co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), cmul, c1), cmo, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  oveq1d(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c0, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmul, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  eqtrd(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmul, c1), co(c1, cexp, co(co(c0, cmin, nat2), caddc, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  oveq2d(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(co(c0, cmin, nat2), caddc, nat1), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(co(c0, cmin, nat2), caddc, nat1)))
  eqtrd(co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(co(c0, cmin, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(c0, cmin, co(nat2, cmin, nat1)), wcel(c0, cprime))
  oveq2d(c0, cmin, nat1, co(nat2, cmin, nat1), wcel(c0, cprime))
  eqcomd(nat1, co(nat2, cmin, nat1), wcel(c0, cprime))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(nat2, cmin, nat1), nat1))
  2m1e1()
  subsubd(c0, nat2, nat1, wcel(c0, cprime))
  zcnd(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  prmz(c0)
  2cnd(wcel(c0, cprime))
  1cnd(wcel(c0, cprime))
  expp1d(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wcel(c1, cc))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn0))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wceq(co(co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), cmul, c1), cmo, c0), co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmul, c1), cmo, c0)), wcel(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cr), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, crp))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wcel(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cr))
  zred(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cz), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn0)))
  ancomd(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn0))
  anim1i(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn0))
  zexpcl(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wcel(c0, crp))
  modmulmod(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), c1, c0)
  oveq1d(co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), cmul, c1), cmo, c0, co(c1, cmul, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), cmul, c1), co(c1, cmul, co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0))))
  mulcomd(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)))
  recnd(co(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cmo, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)))
  modcld(co(c1, cexp, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), c0, wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)))
  reexpcld(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn0))
  prmm2nn0(c0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, crp))
  nnrpd(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  prmnn(c0)

blocks.name: modprm0
blocks.content: For two positive integers less than a given prime number there is always a nonnegative integer (less than the given prime number) so that the sum of one of the two positive integers and the other of the positive integers multiplied by the nonnegative integer is 0 ( modulo the given prime number). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)

blocks.name: nnnn0modprm0
blocks.content: For a positive integer and a nonnegative integer both less than a given prime number there is always a second nonnegative integer (less than the given prime number) so that the sum of this second nonnegative integer multiplied with the positive integer and the first nonnegative integer is 0 ( modulo the given prime number). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 8-Nov-2018.)
